summary:
Communications: Configuration, problem determination, programming. LAN and WAN environments (5 years of experience).

Development: Programming on UNIX/Linux, OS/400, XWindows, MS Windows, DOS, .NET. Using C, C++, C#, Java, Pascal, FORTRAN, Prolog, assembly language, REXX, RPGII, RPGIII and many scripting languages (csh, ksh, bash, perl, python).

Database skills: SQL, MySQL, DB2 (3 years of experience).

Installation, configuration, and support: For AIX (12 years of experience), IBM Common Desktop Environment, AIXWindows (2 years of experience). For IBM WebSphere and BPM on AIX (1 year of experience).

Marketing Support: IBM Systems Engineer (3 years of branch office experience).

Technical Support: International level (2 years of experiemce), country level (2 years of experience), general (10 years of experience).

Management skills: IBM International Technical Support Centre in Austin, Texas (2 years of experience).

Storage skills: TSM, and storage in general, SSA disks, SCSI, optical disks, tape units and libraries, etc. (4 years of experience).

DCE/DFS skills: Major project to install and configure DCE/DFS.

Commercial Helicopter Pilots License with IFR: Team working skills/Risk management. Helicopter pilot in fire-fighting campaigns in Spain (3 years of experience), 1 year as aircraft commander.

profile_positions.description: Providing level 2 technical support for the entire range of Sierra Wireless products including wireless modems, software managememnt tools and radio modules. Technical areas include DNS, VPN, serial communicatoions, MODBUS, CANBUS (vehicle telemetry via J1708/J1939/OBDII), routing, Ethernet, Bluetooth, switches, WiFi, cellular communications, MySQL, Linux administration.
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Support Analyst

profile_positions.description: I have moved to Canada for personal reasons and to facilitate the transition, became self-employed so that I could continue to work for Bankdata remotely as a consultant.
profile_positions.title: IT Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Started work for Bankdata with responsibilities for the installation, customisation, maintenance and administration of set of clustered IBM WebSphere servers hosting IBM BPM. The servers run under AIX on virtual machines on IBM hardware.

Developed skills in the following areas: Agile methodologies, IBM WebSphere in a clustered distributed environment (installation, configuration and administration), IBM BPM, DB2 and jython, perl and bash scripting.
profile_positions.title: Information System Architect

profile_positions.description:
Started work for Securipax with responsibilities including systems administration and maintenance/Development of in-house software tools.

Developed/extended skills in the following areas: testing/problem determination, SQL and MySQL, VMWare, perl, Checkpoint firewall, IPTables firewall, networking.

Major projects included: the maintenance/development of in-house time/project management tool (C#, MySQL) and the development of in-house documentation generation tool (C#, MySQL).
profile_positions.title: Security Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Started work for Hispanica de Aviación as pilot, becoming aircraft commander after 2 years as co-pilot in a twin turbine medium size (6.4 ton MTOW) helicopter.

Developed skills in the following areas: risk management (flights in high risk environments such as fire fighting in mountainous areas, cables, confined areas, etc.), Cockpit Resource Management (working with co-pilot in a high stress environment), team working skills (operating in a multi-aircraft environment over hazardous terrain and coordinating with fire-fighting personnel on the ground), communications skills (coordinating with other fire-fighting air and ground units, as well as ATC at local airports, and when flying IFR).
profile_positions.title: Helicopter Pilot

profile_positions.description:
Left IBM to work for ALMA Technologies with responsibilities for AIX, SP2, Regatta and TSM (Tivoli Storage Manager) projects.

Developed skills in the following areas: large environment management and administration and SP2 management and administration.

Obtained certification in the following: IBM ADSM V3, IBM AIX V4 Administration, IBM SP2 Administration and Solaris and Volume Manager administration (SUN courses).

Major projects included: the development of a client/server tool to aid in SP2 administration, the migration of a 12 node SP2, SP2 installation and configuration and the management of an AIX environment including 4 SP2 (40 nodes), 2 S80, 2M80, a Regatta and 2 ESS 2105.
profile_positions.title: Systems Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Transferred to the AIX services department in IBM Spain with responsibilities for ADSM support throughout Spain as well as general AIX support and project leadership.

Major projects included: the design and implementation of ADSM solutions in many customers and varied environments, the implementation of a DCE/DFS environment, the migration of several applications from HP-UX to AIX, including the conversion of a C program library suite and the implementation of and ADSM environment to provide space management and backup services.
profile_positions.title: Systems Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities included provision of technical support to European customers, the development and presentation of educational material for the support centre staff and the development and implementation of service offerings for related software.

Developed skills in the following areas: management of a support team and the development of service offerings.

Major projects included: the reduction of the size of the ADSM problem queue in line with the requirements of the head of the support centre through the training and management of a team of ADSM specialists.
profile_positions.title: European Technical Support

profile_positions.description:
Product area was storage in the AIX environment with responsibilities for the development and implementation of support plans in specialist areas. The plans included projects designed to develop Redbooks and/or workshops appropriate to the area. Additinal responsibilities included support via telephone or customer visit to large IBM accounts worldwide and general technical support.

Developed skills in the following areas: project design, implementation and management, the function and operation of hardware storage products under AIX, including libraries (optical and tape), disks and RAID arrays, the function and operation of software storage products under AIX, including the operating system itself, ADSM, FSF/6000, Legato Networker, etc.

Major projects included: a Redbook on AIX version 4 storage management, a Redbook comparing the various storage management products available under AIX, develop (and later teach in several countries) a workshop explaining the new features available in the latest version of ADSM, a Redbook on the 7135 RAIDiant Array, a Redbook on SSA architecture and products, a Redbook on ADSM advanced features and a Redbook on management of libraries under ADSM.
profile_positions.title: International Technical Support

profile_positions.description:
Initial area was the AIXWindows environment. After the first year, added CDE and AIX Multimedia. Responsibilities included new product introduction (the management of product introduction within the specialist areas from a technical standpoint), large account support (problem solving or consultancy via telephone or customer visit) and general technical support at country level.

Developed skills in the following areas: AIXWindows environment (installation, configuration, support and development), general AIX (management, operation and development), and the CDE environment (installation, configuration, support and development).

Major projects included: the implementation of a security server and associated API, allowing XWindows workstation locking using a magnetic card and the use of a barcode reader system from the same machine, the modification of the xterm code to customer specification, general X application development and an AIX Multimedia residency in Austin, Texas.
profile_positions.title: Country Technical Support

profile_positions.description:
Started initially as a branch office systems engineer, later becoming branch network specialist with responsibility for technical calls and presentations, workshops and training, problem determination and solution, solution design and configuration and consulting.

Developed design, configuration, implementation, and problem determination skills in the following areas: PC communications, S/36, S/38, and AS/400 communications and configuration, host systems (VTAM and NCP), LAN and WAN, X.25, SNA (including APPN and APPC).

Major projects included: The design and implementation of a user interface to a network design tool (REXX under VM), the implementation of an RJE3780 system (RPGII on AS/400), the design and implementation of a graphical interface to an expert system (C and OS/2 PM), the implementation of a job control subsystem on AS/400 (AS/400 CL).
profile_positions.title: Network Specialist
